text: In this video,

we'll cover how to add Rythm
Bot to your Discord server.

Rythm Bot allows you to play
music to a Discord server

using YouTube and other
platforms based on search.
First, navigate to Rythm.fm.
On the page, click "Invite the bot."

If you're not already
signed in to Discord,
you will be asked to sign in.
You'll then be prompted to
grant admin permissions to the bot
and choose a server to add it to.

Then you can also select
individual permissions.
And when ready, click "Authorize."

Once you are redirected
to the thank-you page,
tab over to Discord.
To get started, join a voice channel
and then try inputting "!play"
followed by the song or playlist URL.
This will play either the song or playlist
from the provided URL.
To play a song based off of a name,
type "!play" followed by the name query.

Rythm automatically
takes songs from YouTube
unless you specify otherwise.

If the song you want doesn't
come up on your first try,

you can use "!search" and
choose the option you want.

If you add more songs before
the current song finishes,
Rythm will automatically create a queue.
To view the queue, type "!queue"
and a pop-up of the queue will appear.
If you ever wonder what song is playing,
you can always type "!nowplaying."
You now have Rythm running

and able to queue a range
of media on your server.

To remove Rythm from the voice
channel and end the session,
type "!disconnect."
